comments.body: I think the end desperately needs an update
Some ideas???
Honestly kind of cool, plus we need to just get rid of wells. they're barely structures. We also need more villages corresponding to biomes.

It's definitely a good idea, but I think it's already in Minecraft.
Just in a different way than you think.
Hmm... an interesting idea. But how would it work with villager breeding? Would it be random, or based on the parents level of technology?
Interesting but not really a minecraft thing, yk? I think it would be a good mod idea but vanilla minecraft just couldn't. Great idea though!

A new structure is needed for Iceologer, otherwise why would he go into such a cold place and what will he study and write to the log?
I think that he needs some kind of dwelling with access to the water, because apart from fish in such a climate there is nothing to eat, he still needs a place for "iceology". I think it's like archeology and paleontology, but not in the ground, but in solid ice and snow.

I have a similar idea, Its still pending approval for some reason tho.

My idea is called 'THE ICE CLOUD'... Its a giant ice-spikes Biome turned upside down, put in the sky, and then its flat on top, with topsnow!
like monkeys in the jungle!  and bananas

I totally agree.  The biomes still feel empty without more animals.  We need some birds, deer and brown bears in the forests.  Perhaps some monkeys in the jungle!  Maybe even some penguins in the snow biomes!
Note: Due to running out of space, I was unable to provide more ideas I have, but I do have a structure thought of for this biome called the observatory.
Could the Experiencer live here?
Whats the Eperiencer?
A scientist who bottles xp
Although the Experiencer may not fit in the Astral Peaks or Observatory, it's a cool idea that would add some more incentive to go to the Astral Peaks biome.
Very thorough
We need rain more often in rainforests
I really hope itâ€™s a good idea.
people would just live in the no mobs biome forever because... there no mobs

These aren't the right kind of cherry tree that can provide palatable fruit.

Also, without a unique purpose it's pointless.
I heard that they might add a new dimension
Something somewhat like a hostile dimension? That be epic!
Yeah, there should be an abyssal ocean, right now the oceans are the same depth as lakes or even shallower.
This is cool

This has literally been suggested over and over, and there are several mods for it. If you're going to make a suggestion on the feedback page, PLEASE provide some actual information or ideas instead of a generic single sentence that provides no insight.

How would the seasons work? How would they make it different from all the mod versions out there? How exactly would they improve trees? There's not a lot of go off of here.
Improved trees: Maybe introduce "burned" trees (trees without leaves) in dry biomes - in savanna, wooded badlands and very rarely in deserts.
What do you call this jungle variant?
SerÃ­a muy real y bonito ese bioma asi
I think it's a bit too similar to the new mangrove swamps. Why not add orchids and some other colorful plants to the "normal" jungle?
I don't think this makes sense as an actual biome.  It sounds more like a unique structure to me.

Yes that crossed my mind as well. If needed I think adding new unique plant life could help. Like more End tree variants. If you have any suggestions I am open. Thank you for saying that. Feedback is very appreciated.

The other thing is the other dimensions currently don't have biomes in the same way the overworld does.  Their biomes are just variations on how the terrain generates, and I'm not sure most people would even recognize that there is a different biome.  I know that adding biomes in The Nether is something people want, but I'm not sure it works as well for The End.  Even mods I see tend to add new ores, structures, and mobs, but don't tend to add biomes.

I just think you should focus all of your information on your structures post for this idea.
Noted. If I do focus on the idea as a structure should I scrap the spreading aspect?

Skip the spredding, it could be used to severely troll a lot of players, imagine coming home to your house and itâ€™s filled with pointy bushes that teleport you and you have no way to remove it. Give it an effect like the chorus fruit teleporting into a random space within so many blocks. Potted versions can be added to end cities shulkers cause you to float upwards and into it teleporting you randomly somewhere else.

Actually I feel the spreading could be saved. Things from the end have a tendancy to hate water. Flowing water can bring down an entire chorus tree. Simply make water have the same effect on the tangle roots.
That could work @sonicrushfive

I dont like the idea of it spreading

It also might be a bit challenging for the devs
I like the idea of it or some other block/growth spreading.  If it's very slow I don't see the harm.  A horizontal version of chorus plants.
The aqua leggings are a TERRIBLE idea ðŸ’”
Wow this is an amazing idea I actually really like it but no offence there is one problem. It is really expensive since hearts of the sea can take an hour to dig out

When bows are fired underwater they are slowed down a lot.
Loosened skeletons would need to be able to shoot without the water slowing effect.

- Koalas spawn in outback (sub-biome of savannah) trees and there is a 10% chance of them spawning as drop bears with red eyes and are hostile mobs that drop out of the trees. Can be tamed with leaves and once tamed will climb onto back and add extra inventory. Once killed they may drop nothing but there is a small chance that they drop something rare. Could maybe drop leather or wool/fur and meat. spawn in trees in groups of 1-4.

Great idea. 

The Koalas need somewhere to live and eat.

Go here and vote for Koalas please;l

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360011226051-Koala?page=1#community_comment_360007092691
It's biomes like these that make them more tremendous to look at.

Here are my thoughts for the biome!

Eucalyptus Forests spawn beside savannah biomes and have

  • Koalas (with a special tree kangaroo variant)
  • Kangaroos
  • Mushrooms
  • Bushes
  • Grass
  • Eucalyptus Trees (Regular and Rainbow)

Eucalyptus Trees have a reddish-orange wood that fits between mangrove and acacia wood.

By bonemealing eucalyptus trees, you get eucalyptus propagate!

I agree. I'm not convinced on the "terrifying"-ness of the pale garden, and the Creaking mob seems kinda goofy since you'd be looking at it a lot. I think a thick white fog would add a lot to the mood and make dealing with the Creaking scarier.
YES, THIS IS A GOOD IDEA
Sim! NÃ©voa nesse bioma melhoraria muito mais a atmosfera
my immediate thought for the pale garden was to add fog. this is the biome that fog would work the best in

i back this, additionally it would be interesting if they added a new haze-like feature to the game that just lingers above and around the pale garden, it would make the biome feel less out of place as well
Simple yet important suggestion. Pale Garden NEEDS fog

I also agree! A thick fog can also make the sky look brighter at night and dim in daytime, which is a contrast that I think really fit the theme. Having a fog would also lower the rendering distance, which provides an isolated feel when you're in the biome, as if the Pale Garden is the whole world since you can't see farther into other biomes.

One good suggestion that I've seen elsewhere is the idea of a "Fog Flower" that could spawn in the biome. This could cause a fog effect in the area around the flower in a similar way to the spore blossom or cherry leaves. It could also be silk touched / sheared and placed in your builds where you would like some creepy fog effects.

Yes please. It would add so much more atmosphere to the biome, I'd especially love it if players could see the fog surrounding the forest from far away like a thick heavy cloud of fog, that catches their attention and draws them in. And other players to run away.

Additionally, once you enter the boundary of the forest, I'd appreciate if Mojang could add a new slider into the settings menu that allows players to change the intensity of the fog to their liking. That way it can be so thick you can't see anything at night outside of the glowing eyes of the creeking and the glow from it's heart block, but also a player can get rid of the fog entirely if they don't want it in their play style. It gives players the option of fog, which would be my ideal choice with the slider making it so a player can strengthen or weaken to their own level.

Additionally, this could be a fun excuse to include the fireflies back into the game, ones who's color look a little similar to the creeking. But the fireflies are always active regardless of the time of day, which when the Creeking comes out, players think it's a firefly initially dropping their guard until the realize what it truly is. Plus it would add extra atmosphere to the fog previously suggested. Do it Mojang. We want it. It also would heavily separate the Pale Garden from the Dark Oak Forest, which already looks extremely similar based on the current terrain generation.
I think Spectator mode and hardcore mode would be great and maybe in hardcore mode mobs can break blocks
break blocks!?!?!?!!?!?!?
i aggre with that

I think hardcore mode will be bad because I keep dying randomly in survival.

But I still like spectator mode in bedrock.
Siiiiiiii
I really want hardcore mode to bedrock because when Iâ€™m playing minecraft I can finally play with one life. Iâ€™m tired of respawning and respawning over and over again.
We need this right away

We need to have these options for bedrock edition. Add this feature mojang, please I beg you. I know itâ€™s ways to do it via the computer, but at least IT would be much simpilar to just tap the buttom, and they those chunks resets. These options needs to come befordre the ps5 comes. Your mission is to get these options back, mojang. I beg you mojang. Please add these features.

especially with the new nether update, I went so far into my first bedrock world, I obtained diamonds and new pets but honestly man I want the nether to reset so I can actually get netherite without making a whole new world because honestly, that's too much of an effort to do just to get the new armor

When we are fighting the enderdragon we just beat him and then the secon time we set four endcrystal in the middle of the four. It would be easier to just reset the end, and then the dragon will spawn. I have a strong feeling that this will be included in ps5 or the end update. Microsoft owns Minecraft, so they gotto work with this now or many would be very upset.
we used to have this back on Xbox 360 and PS3, but we desperately need it back for this update, there's a world I have that I've put months into with my friends and I would hate to see it all go.

Yes Please, I had a world in minecraft ps4 edition where I had a lot of minerals And constructions, I havenâ€™t finished that world (havenâ€™t beaten the ender dragon) and now with the new nether update I wanted to Bering the new minerals and blocks of the nether but i canâ€™t reset the nether and i had ti restart a new world

We need this so bad on console because of the whole new nether update and it was on old versions and pc has it fine by deleting one file. If we could even find that file one the ps4 without needing 3rd party software that would be nice.

Dear Mojang, Please!
At the very least if you don't want to allow users core file access then please create a utility or setting for us to be able to reset these worlds. It is after all Microsoft. 
We have a five year old world for our entire family with everyone's builds and both the End as well as the Nether are heavily explored. Starting a new overworld world or having to travel thousands of blocks just for new content in these two worlds is really quite frustrating. Especially since it is easily done in Java.
yo i died with the dragon egg in an end city and cant find the egg do it despawn or am i a bad looker i need a reset end option
Help us Mojang-wan-Kenobi, you're our only hope.
2023 and this still isn't a feature. Amazing how this was on the legacy consoles then they borked it with the next gen update.

I think this is a great idea!

Finding mysterious ruins while mining for Ancient Debris would add a lot to the story of the Nether and Minecraft in general, and they would be fun to explore.

Ocean-ruins type stuff would be awesome. In order for this to work well, there needs to be something that allows you to swim in lava (if not see through it)

The void is an End thing. Call them Lavafish.

A wither skeleton spawner isn't something I really want to see in the game since WS's have such valuable drops. Also, I think the wither aspect of the nether and the fiery lava aspect should be kept separate (except in fortresses)

Anything that makes the bottom nether generation better gets my vote! Mining for ancient debris is a chore mostly because there are hardly 'caves', and you're mining through so much ugly netherrack. There being lots of lava springs don't help either.

This would make acquiring ancient debris fun and satisfying.
I like the idea ancient debris is put with ruined buildings. It makes ancient debris more interesting.
Maybe instead of acid the river could be a Void River that will start draining your experience points to zero, then drain the durability of your armor starting with your boots if you fall in it. :O
Dang I wish this got more attention :)
I would LOVE and end update. As it is itâ€™s pretty boring in the end much like the nether used to be.
ya I believe that the end needs an update and the over world
External links is this allowed?
I just relised i wote this uggestion on my old account.
Dr. Thezbi Kazo approves of this idea.
Thank you! The number of votes are growing!
omg this is so good maybe change the title for more attention
omg this is so good maybe change the title for more attention
I really like the idea! Could you maybe make it so the top has a spring sometimes, (with normal water ) and the players thatâ€™s get up there get an achievement?
I like the concept, but id like it to be called Waterfalls instead of extreme falls because extreme hills are called mountains now
Great idea! Maybe these biomes can also spawn in the jungle biome. Also these biomes should have a basin at the bottom of the waterfall and there should be rivers leading up to the waterfall

Please want to dance with me in minecraft m
Please, please

I like the idea of making basalt more common, but maybe it shouldn't generate in a fully solid layer as that would be a bit overwhelming. Instead, you could find it in patches, similarly to granite, diorite and andesite in the Overworld.
I agree with Jakub Zeleznik

I think it should be in a kind of patchy layer, similar to how the bedrock gets at y=5. This would cause your mining speed to fluctuate as you go, which would make mining in the nether less monotonous and kind of risky/unpredictable, which fits the dimension quite well.
I also agree with jabuk zelenik because netherack is easy to mine and this could add pockets to either avoid or persevere through make nether mining less dull.
Perhaps a 'hardened netherrack' would work better for this, as the basalt is in the soul sand valley.

I did something similar in one of my mods, where overworld basalt which is black, and could go with blackstone, replaces almost all stone where the lava is and from bedrock to Y 24.

 

There should be more variants of basalt like rename polished to basalt pillar, add basalt bricks and tiles. Current polished basalt made with 2 vertically, bricks made with 2*2 and tiles made with 3*3, similar to purpur borders. I also think rough basalt should be made with smelting basalt, with the top texture on all 6 sides.
